Looking East over the Colorado River

div.p: Looking East over the Colorado River

img.alt: Columbus Junior High School - Riverside Campus

a.span: Columbus Junior High School - Riverside Campus

div.div: Welcome to the Columbus Independent School District website. Our desire is for you to find this site user friendly and easily navigated. Columbus I.S.D. serves the educational needs of over 1500 students. Columbus I.S.D. is located in beautiful, historic Columbus, TX, on the banks of the majestic Colorado River. Our district shares the same small-town charm as our town, and for that we are very proud. We provide a safe educational setting for our students and faculty, as this is our top priority. Columbus I.S.D. works daily to meet the needs of all our students and to ensure that the education they receive is of the highest quality. Upon graduation our all our students will be ready for college, a career or the military. We believe that you will not find a more dedicated faculty, who will provide the best educational experience for your children in Colorado County, or the State of Texas. Our teachers, paraprofessionals and principals are dedicated professionals who work tirelessly to provide a 21st century education for all students. Our office staff, maintenance, custodians and transportation personnel work to provide the best learning environment possible and we are thankful for every one of them. We are excited to work with you, to provide the highest quality education our students deserve. Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns.
Join our Code_Red (CISD) Remind group to receive texts about pertinent district information: https://www.remind.com/join/coderedisd
Employees can access email via this link: https://goo.gl/uv4PQA (bookmark this link)

article.aria-label: Last Day of School / Early Dismissal

h3.a: Last Day of School / Early Dismissal

div.div: As a result of the COVID-19 recess from standard instruction, Columbus ISD is instituting a new grading system recommended by the Texas Education Agency. The parent portal in TxEIS Gradebook will be temporarily closed for reconfiguration of grades. We are sorry for this inconvenience. The portal will reopen as soon as the reconfiguration is complete.

article.aria-label: Columbus ISD Softball Complex Design Development

h3.a: Columbus ISD Softball Complex Design Development

article.aria-label: Video/Audio Conferencing Notice for Board Meeting:

h3.a: Video/Audio Conferencing Notice for Board Meeting:

div.div:
Video/Audio Conferencing Notice: Pursuant to the Governor Abbott’s Temporary Suspension of Open Meetings Laws issued on March 16, 2020 and the Governor’s order dated March 19,2020, prohibiting gatherings of 10 or more people, this meeting will be conducted via video conference or audio conference which will be audible and/or viewable to the Board and public. The Board President, presiding officer or trustees may not be physically present at one location but a quorum will be required for the meeting. The public may access this meeting by logging on to the Columbus ISD Facebook Page, https://www.facebook.com/columbusisdtx/. An electronic copy of the agenda packet may be viewed at the following link: https://v3.boardbook.org/Public/PublicHome.aspx?ak=0045902. A recording of the meeting will be available for viewing on the District’s website.
Should you wish to address the board during public comment, please submit your comments to Theresa Portwood via e-mail at portwoodt@columbusisd.org, prior to the beginning of the meeting. Your comments will be provided to all board members attending the meeting during the public comment portion of the board meeting and will be read aloud. You must identify yourself for your comments to be considered and state the item you are addressing. Please put the following in the subject line: “Public Comment for 4/20/2020 Board Meeting.”

article.aria-label: Columbus ISD Closed for the Remainder of School Year

h3.a: Columbus ISD Closed for the Remainder of School Year

div.div: The Texas Education Agency has provided school districts with guidance on what is required for students during school closures due to COVID-19. Even though students will not be able to go to their school’s campus, learning will continue through remote learning via Google Classroom, or the picking up of physical packets from your child’s campus. This will continue in accordance with the CISD school calendar until the last day of school. Columbus ISD invites you to check the COVID-19 resource page on the District’s website for updates and additional information by clicking "Read full story". Remember, apart we stand together and together we are C-Town Strong! Go Cards!
